value.title: How to import Markdown into Medium

content.subtitle: I’ve figured out an easy way to import Markdown into Medium.

paragraphs.name: c02e
paragraphs.text: How to import Markdown into Medium

paragraphs.name: 643d
paragraphs.text: I’ve figured out an easy way to import Markdown into Medium.

paragraphs.name: 77e0
paragraphs.text: I write these Train of Thoughts posts as Markdown files. Medium doesn’t allow for Markdown in a story, leaving me with random #, *, _, and [] throughout my story.

paragraphs.name: 04b8
paragraphs.text: At first, I had to manually go through and modify my story in Medium and remove all of my markdown formatting. This was a pain. Here’s how I fixed it (NOTE: you will need a GitHub account to do this):

paragraphs.name: 780b
paragraphs.text: 1. Go to gist.github.com and select “markdown” as the Language (or just give it a filed name with a .md extension)

paragraphs.name: 69ff
paragraphs.text: 2. Copy/Paste your markdown file into your gist.

paragraphs.name: 150f
paragraphs.text: 4. Copy URL of your newly created secret gist

paragraphs.name: f8e0
paragraphs.text: 5. Go to Medium and select “Import Story”

paragraphs.name: e8ce
paragraphs.text: That’s it. You can then remove the “Originally published…” at the end of the Medium story if you want.

paragraphs.name: b5b6
paragraphs.text: This works because secret gists aren’t 100% hidden, they can be accessed by the URL directly. It’s not as easy as it could be if Medium supported Markdown, but it’s far easier than manually reformatting your entire story in Medium.
